entry.title: Aoubut Me
entry.content:
I am a Ph.D. Candidate at State Key Laboratory of Computer Architecture in The Institute of Computing Technology of the Chinese Academy of Sciences. I received my bachelor degree in Computer Science from Tsinghua University.

My research focuses on understanding individual behaviors at the micro level and community dynamics at the macro level. I aim to harness emerging data in social interactions to explain and predict human decisions, whereby enhancing social and technological systems. I am currently supported by a Facebook fellowship. Here is my CV.
entry.summary: I am a Ph.D. Candidate at State Key Lab

entry.title: Papers
entry.content: I am a Ph.D. Candidate in Computer Science at Cornell University. I am fortunate to be advised by Lillian Lee, and I have Jon Kleinberg and Bobby Kleinberg on my committee. Previously, I received my bachelor degree in Computer Science from Tsinghua University, with a second degree in Economics.
